job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Toronto, ON
pros: You can transfer HOOPP benefits from other employers. The hospital is in downtown Toronto and is accessible by car, or public transportation. A teaching hospital that has a large pool of ethnically diverse, medically trained personnel.
cons: A teaching hospital with a large pool of ethnically diverse personnel, however no visible minorities hold jobs in management, middle- management or higher. Very few if any visible minorities such as Black or Indigenous people are employed in Human Resources. The hospital does not have a diversity officer, and has historically dealt poorly with issues such as racism and bullying against co-workers, because they don’t understand other people’s cultures. This hospital also does not consult with or value taking advice from nursing. Things and events happen to nurses and they leave or retire. This has resulted in a problematic nursing retention problem on the wards and in ICU areas.

review_title: Great Place to work lots to learn
pros:
A lot of great exposure in how the financial operations are run for a hospital and not for profit organization. 

Great ability to collaborate with different departments to understand their priorities and processes to improve operations and results of my clients.

Leaders and front line staff in the Office of Research Administration and Finance Offices are available to support initiatives that you see as opportunities. 

A lot of autonomy and trust to get the job done.

If you are focused on building your own equity in being a solid financial expert Unity Health Toronto / St. Michaels Hospital will give you those opportunities. If the opportunity does not present itself in house you will be prepared when external opportunities present themselves.
cons:
If you have the will and perspective to take each challenge without judgement you will be fine. 

When working in a company with a lot of personalities and high performing staff, being able to navigate this environment is important, otherwise you may not last long.

- little onboarding process for research centre I was in
- few opportunities for advancement/mentorship

- ethics of research processes were not as respected/followed as they should be 
- sometimes research had harmful implications

review_title: Great place to work and go home with no stress
job_title: Supply Chain and Services Staff in Toronto, ON
pros: Really good culture. Everyone is very relaxed and comfortable in their job. Some very smart people run all everything, so get to know who they are and learn from them. Very good salary and understanding managers when you need time off.
cons: People have no drive and ambition there. Very easy pace of getting things done. They call in consultants to improve the systems, but its just a waste of money as the people are not motivated or passionate about their jobs. Its a good place if you just want a steady paycheck. Limited opportunities for progress unless someone retires. people don't really seek for other jobs once they get there.

pros: Very nice, hardworking staff. Hospital environment can be busy, so people work hard. The values at St. Michael's are amazing. They really care about patients, really dedicate time to their inner-city clientele.  Lots of focus on education and research. Yearly employee appreciation events (summer BBQ, Holiday party, awards), and employee engagement survey. Good pay, great benefits, great tuition assistance program.
cons: Overall pretty good, but if you don't have a medical background it is really hard to advance (even if you want to advance in an administrative or managerial role). Sometimes people are promoted because of their medical background, not because they are suitable to be managers. Overall though, it is a great place to work - people who work here tend to stay here, and that says alot.

pros: St. Michael's offers a great work environment. People tend to be friendly, cooperative, and willing to help each other. The salaries seem fair compared to other institutions and the benefits are good. From my own experience, and what I've heard from other employees, the expectations in terms of work-life balance are very fair.
cons: I really can't think of any cons that are specific to St. Mike's. There are certain negative aspects such as bureaucracy and administrative hurdles, but these exist at most large organizations.

pros: Good salary and benefits. Interesting to work with some of the Doctors and Residents.
cons: The worst work experience I have ever had. Dishonest, evil management in Medical Imaging Department, toxic environment, where people are harassed and emotionally abused by management without any liability. Work culture: Mobbing, bullying of targeted employees by management is ignored and supported by Human Resources. Hard work, experience, knowledge are not valued. There is no room for decency and integrity in this department/Hospital.

review_title: ST. Michael's Hospital is an excellent employer.
pros: There are lots of opportunities for gaining experience in various departments as the Hospital is quite large.  There are also many opportunities for advancement.
cons: Budget restraints prevent optimal staffing numbers.  Each remaining position can be overburdened with workloads.

pros: because i like to help people . I find it personally  rewarding to help people overcome health challenges and continue to live with dignity and independence.Based on my training , I feel that is a profession I would truly love.
cons: so far I don't have experience of the downsides only from my agency if they changed my schedule without letting me in advance.

pros:
Competitive pay, good benefits and vacation package, even for contract staff.
Management team is very approachable and collaborative.
Supportive of professional development.
HR encourages permanent positions after 1 or 2 years of contract.
cons:
Still a little behind on providing work-life balance and telecommuting options. 
Some departments are constantly under-staffed so certain tasks can take a very long time to complete, and sometimes with many errors.

pros: I really get along with my coworkers and I am overall motivated by my work. The location is great for commuting by public transit. This is a good first job to gain experience.
cons: Discouraged by the management of this place. I was asked to prove myself (i.e. volunteer) for 6 months before they considered giving me a paid job. Tasks are assigned with little notice. It is very difficult to negotiate a raise even after years on the job.

pros: Good HR, permanent positions in research are available and encouraged by HR. Pay is competitive. The management team is very personable and helpful. Good benefits for permanent and contract employees (no premium for extended health care benefits). Lots of professional development opportunities.
cons: Contract roles do not get paid sick leave, and stat pay is based on hours worked in previous 2 pay periods, so if you take vacation, your stat pay gets docked. The company does not encourage telecommuting.

pros: Some of the staff here is really talented, professional and kind.  There is legitimate research being published from this site.
cons:
There is absolutely no recourse if abuse occurs, no matter how illegal or unethical, and the complaint process doesn't protect postdocs.  Read your contract,  if you take a job here as a postdoc you're an at-will employee and can be fired with no repercussions no matter who is at fault.  

I wish I'd realized how vulnerable I was before taking a job here.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros:
- Great environment - the institution value the employees and always provide training sessions, wellness programs and incentives for research
- Well prepared and caring professionals
- Hospital is always growing and becoming references and diverse areas of care, such as trauma, intensive care, cardiovascular...
- Benefits are very good
cons:
Hourly rate (Salary) are lower than other institutions

review_title: Great experience, lots of networking opportunities. Can be lots of work sometimes

cons: Sometimes too much work, employees higher then you might take advantage of you, salary is good however could be a little better, not really many other negative things though.

review_title: Great if you're a permanent employee
pros:
I worked with some of the greatest people who not only were intelligent, but were understanding, reasonable, and friendly.
The actual work itself was very rewarding.
cons: I was a contract employee for almost 3 years before they offered me a permanent position. Some of the contracts offered were sometimes only for a one month extension, so in that sense stability was incredibly low.
